servinfo.title: Pistons, Piston Rings, Connecting Rods and Cylinders Removal and Installation

ptxt.intxrefpoff: Pistons, Piston Rings, Connecting Rods and Cylinders Components

s1.ptxt: Remove engine assembly from vehicle referring to Engine Assembly Removal and Installation .
Remove cylinder heads. Refer to Valves and Cylinder Heads Removal and Installation .
Remove oil pump. Refer to Oil Pump and Oil Pump Chain Removal and Installation .
Mark cylinder number on all pistons, connecting rods and connecting rod bearing caps.
Remove connecting rod bearing caps.
Clean carbon from top of cylinder bore before removing piston from cylinder.
Push piston and connecting rod assembly out through the top of cylinder bore.

ptxt.intxrefpoff: Pistons, Piston Rings, Connecting Rods and Cylinders Disassembly and Reassembly
Cylinders, Pistons and Piston Rings Inspection
Piston Pins and Connecting Rods Inspection
Crank Pins and Connecting Rod Bearings Inspection

s1.ptxt: Apply engine oil to pistons, rings, cylinder walls, connecting rod bearings and crank pins.

attention3.ptxt: Do not apply oil between connecting rod and bearing or between bearing cap and bearing.

s1.ptxt: When installing piston and connecting rod assembly into cylinder bore, point mark (1) on piston head to crankshaft pulley side (2).
Install piston and connecting rod assembly into cylinder bore. Use special tool (Piston ring compressor) to compress rings. Guide connecting rod into place on crankshaft.
Using a hammer handle, tap piston head to install piston into bore. Hold ring compressor firmly against cylinder block until all piston rings have entered cylinder bore.
Install connecting rod bearing cap (1) as follows.

attention3.ptxt: If connecting rod bolt is reused, mark sure to check connecting rod bolt for deformation referring to “Connecting Rod Bolt Deformation (Plastic Deformation Tightening Bolt)” under Crank Pins and Connecting Rod Bearings Inspection .

s2.ptxt: Point arrow mark (2) on cap to crankshaft pulley side.
Apply engine oil to new connecting rod bolts (3).
Tighten all connecting rod bolts to 15 N·m (1.5 kgf-m, 11.0 lbf-ft).

torqueitem.t-note: Tighten 15 N·m (1.5 kgf-m,11.0 lbf-ft), 45° and 45° by the specified procedure.

s1.ptxt: Install cylinder heads to cylinder block referring to Valves and Cylinder Heads Removal and Installation .
Install oil pump to cylinder block referring to Oil Pump and Oil Pump Chain Removal and Installation .
Install tappets, shims and camshafts referring to Camshafts, Tappets and Shims Removal and Installation .
Install RH (No.2) bank 2nd timing chain referring to RH (No.2) Bank 2nd Timing Chain and Chain Tensioner Removal and Installation .
Install 1st timing chain. Refer to 1st Timing Chain and Chain Tensioner Removal and Installation .
Install LH (No.1) bank 2nd timing chain. Refer to LH (No.1) Bank 2nd Timing Chain and Chain Tensioner Removal and Installation .
Install timing chain cover. Refer to Timing Chain Cover Removal and Installation .
Install oil pans and pump strainer. Refer to Oil Pan and Oil Pump Strainer Removal and Installation .
Install cylinder head covers. Refer to Cylinder Head Covers Removal and Installation .
Install exhaust manifold. Refer to Exhaust Manifold Removal and Installation .
Install radiator outlet pipe.
Refer to Cooling Water Pipes or Hoses Removal and Installation .

Install intake manifold, intake collector and electric throttle body assembly referring to Intake Collector and Intake Manifold Removal and Installation and Electric Throttle Body Assembly Removal and Installation .
Install engine assembly to vehicle referring to Engine Assembly Removal and Installation .
